VPR.Q: What is the overall spatial distribution pattern shown in the heatmap?
VPR.A: The heatmap shows a {radial gradient} pattern.

What is the heat value of the cell corresponding to Coal and Storage in the heatmap?

EVJ.Q: What is the global maximum heat value in the heatmap?
EVJ.A: The global maximum heat value is {0.84}.

EVJ.Q: What is the global minimum heat value in the heatmap?
EVJ.A: The global minimum heat value is {0.11}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum heat value of label Renewables on the x-axis?
EVJ.A: The maximum heat value of Renewables on the x-axis is {0.78}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum heat value of label Transmission on the x-axis?
EVJ.A: The maximum heat value of Transmission on the x-axis is {0.80}.

SC.Q: What is the average heat value for label Nuclear on the x-axis?
SC.A: The average heat value for Nuclear on the x-axis is {0.46}.

SC.Q: What is the average heat value for label Distribution on the x-axis?
SC.A: The average heat value for Distribution on the x-axis is {0.69}.

SC.Q: What is the average heat value for label Production on the y-axis?
SC.A: The average heat value for Production on the y-axis is {0.62}.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Distribution and Infrastructure or the cell corresponding to Gas and Storage?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Gas} and {Storage} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Water and Consumption or the cell corresponding to Renewables and Policy?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Renewables} and {Policy} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Water and Policy or the cell corresponding to Nuclear and Production?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Nuclear} and {Production} has a higher heat value.

MSR.Q: In the heatmap, what are the row and column labels for all cells whose heat values fall within the range of 0.12 to 0.22?
MSR.A: The cells are: {(Renewables, Consumption), (Transmission, Consumption), (Water, Consumption), (Renewables, Emissions), (Transmission, Emissions), (Renewables, Infrastructure), (Water, Infrastructure), (Transmission, Policy)}.
